title: [Sunset] Datasmith Twinmotion Content for Unreal Engine (beta)
description: Twinmotion library assets for importing Datasmith files that were exported from Twinmotion
longDescription:
The Datasmith Twinmotion Content plugin is currently in Beta (Beta 1 - Release date December 12th, 2022)

With the release of Twinmotion 2023.1, we have implemented a Datasmith Export function. Datasmith files, and all the necessary referenced assets, can be easily imported into the Unreal Editor with this updated plugin.

Community:

General discussions and questions about this feature will be hosted on the Unreal Engine discussion forums here: https://forums.unrealengine.com/tags/intersection/unreal-engine/datasmith

If you encounter any issues with the import of Datasmith files into the Unreal Editor, please refer to the Unreal Engine forums.

If you experience any bugs while exporting Datasmith files from Twinmotion, please use the Twinmotion Support Community to report a bug by using the [ contact us ] button: https://twinmotionhelp.epicgames.com/



UE-Only Content - Licensed for Use Only with Unreal Engine-based Products
technicalDetails:
The content plugin file size has been reduced; this new plugin is only 574 megabytes compared to the original Twinmotion Content for Unreal Engine plugin.

Exporting and importing via Datasmith should be functionally equivalent to using the previous Twinmotion to Unreal Engine workflow.

Please refer to Twinmotion Datasmith Exporter Feature Brief on how to install and get started using this new improved workflow.


Currently not supported:

  • Video textures
  • Construction machines
  • Boats
  • Skeletal mesh (animated objects)
  • Particles
  • Paths (bikes and characters)
  • Sounds 
  • HDRI
  • Environment light
  • Location and time of day
  • Weather and weather effects
  • Cycloramas
  • LED Wall
  • Reflection probes
  • Notes
  • Measure tool
  • Sections


Import Workflow:

The workflow is based on Datasmith. If you are not familiar with how Datasmith works, please consult the documentation here.


Installation, Usage:

You only need to install this plugin to successfully import Datasmith files exported from Twinmotion.

Please refer to this document for a complete description about how to install and use this plugin as well as information on what is expected to work, known issues.
